message_1: In how many ways can you choose two different flavors of ice cream from 5 flavors (vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, mint, and coffee) to create a two-scoop ice cream cone?
message_2:
To create a two-scoop ice cream cone with two different flavors, we can use the combination formula. The combination formula is used to find the number of ways to choose k items from a set of n items without regard to the order of the items. The formula is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

In this case, we have 5 flavors (n = 5) and we want to choose 2 flavors (k = 2). Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

C(5, 2) = 5! / (2!(5-2)!)
C(5, 2) = 5! / (2!3!)
C(5, 2) = (5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((2 × 1)(3 × 2 × 1))
C(5, 2) = (120) / (2 × 6)
C(5, 2) = 120 / 12
C(5, 2) = 10

So, there are 10 ways to choose two different flavors of ice cream from 5 flavors to create a two-scoop ice cream cone.
